TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CustomLabel extends System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement

Docs.summary: Represents a custom label for an axis.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects are stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection> class, which is exposed as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.CustomLabels%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> class.
Axis labels for the first label row are automatically generated unless custom labels are specified using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.CustomLabels%2A> property. If you specify a custom label along the first label row, no axis labels will be automatically generated for the entire first row.
Only custom labels may be used for the second label row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ToPosition%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> properties determine the axis range that the label applies to.
A grid line and/or tick mark can be displayed for a custom axis label by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.GridTicks%2A> property; this property specifies whether a custom grid line or tick mark will be drawn in the middle of the label range.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor can be used to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> class.
However, it is recommended that you use one of the `Add` methods in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabelsCollection> class to add custom labels.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text color of the custom label.
Docs.value: A value that represents the text color of a custom label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ForeColor%2A> property determines the text color for a custom label.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the beginning position, in axis coordinates, of the custom label.
Docs.value: A value that represents the beginning of the axis range that the label is applied to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> property determines the start position of the axis range the label is applied to.
The difference between the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ToPosition%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> properties determines where the label text will be displayed. For example, suppose the X-axis has a scale that ranges from 1 to 5 (1, 2 ,3 , 4, 5). In order to display a custom label just underneath the second point, you would set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ToPosition%2A> property to 1.5 and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> property to 2.5.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.XValueType%2A>—or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.YValueType%2A>, depending on the axis in question—is set to a <xref:System.DateTime> value, then this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> property will be displayed as a <xref:System.DateTime> value in the designer.
This property should not be set to the same value as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ToPosition%2A> property.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.FlagsEnumUITypeEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.value: A enumeration value that specifies whether custom tick marks and grid lines will be drawn in the center of the label.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a color that will be replaced with a transparent color when a custom label image is drawn.
Docs.value: A value which is replaced with a transparent color when a custom label image is drawn. The default value is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the label mark for a custom label. This applies to labels in rows other than the first row.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines the type of label mark, if any, to be used.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Label marks can only be used for the second row of labels, and are usually used to group labels together from the first row.
The major tick mark's line style of the relevant <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object is used for the line pattern of the mark, for example, the AxisX.MajorTickMark.LineDashStyle property.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the marker color for the custom label.
Docs.value: A value that represents the marker color of a custom label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.MarkColor%2A> property determines the color of a custom label's marker.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the custom label.
Docs.value: A value that represents the text name of the custom label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A string value that represents the text name of the item.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the index of the custom label row.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the index, 0 to 10, of the custom label row.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.RowIndex%2A> property specifies the index of the row label where zero is the row label closest to the axis to ten, the further most axis label.
Only custom labels can be used for the label rows beyond the first row.
If a custom label is used for the first row, labels for that entire axis will not be generated automatically; in this case, all labels for the first row must then be custom labels.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the custom label text.
Docs.value: A value that represents the label text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.Text%2A> property gets or sets the label text of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> object.
Note that axis labels for the first label row are generated automatically, but can be overridden using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects. If you specify a custom label along the first axis row, no axis labels will be automatically generated for the entire first row.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the custom label tooltip text.
Docs.value: A that represents the tooltip text.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the starting position of the custom label, in axis coordinates.
Docs.value: A value that represents the starting position.
